node.title: A Damien Hirst Touch for the Table
node.description: The Gagosian Gallery now sells a tea towel inspired by the artistâ€™s Spot paintings.
node.content: ["Restaurants have been using dish towels as table napkins for years. Here\u2019s a tea towel that begs for that application, or even to be used as a place mat. Based on the famous Spot paintings by Damien Hirst, it\u2019s a 21-by-17 \u00bd-inch cotton rectangle from Gagosian Gallery\u2019s newly redesigned online shop.", "Follow NYT Food on Twitter and NYT Cooking on Instagram, Facebook and Pinterest. Get regular updates from NYT Cooking, with recipe suggestions, cooking tips and shopping advice."]
